formattedAddress: 100 E 63rd St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 100 E 63rd St, New York, NY 10065, USA

editorialSummary.text: Daniel Boulud's cafe serving high-end French fare in a chic setting.

originalText.text: The atmosphere was great and service was exceptional but the food was very underwhelming. I went for new years eve and the menu was limited, yet supposedly their most popular dishes. The pepper crusted scallops were okay, it was paired well with the mandarins but besides that, it was nothing special, didnt bother finishing the bland beans underneath. I was excited to try the unique beet ravioli but this was another meh dish that was presented much better than it tasted. The cod was fine, nothing special, the sauce was good but still felt very basic. The dessert options were all terrible, our table tried the gingerbread cranberry, chocolate layered mouse and the apple pie and the pie was the best option, but the others weren't worth finishing. I was looking forward to trying the desserts from the regular menu but unfortunately it was not an option for nye. All in all, service and presentation met expectations but the food was forgettable.

text.text: The atmosphere was great and service was exceptional but the food was very underwhelming. I went for new years eve and the menu was limited, yet supposedly their most popular dishes. The pepper crusted scallops were okay, it was paired well with the mandarins but besides that, it was nothing special, didnt bother finishing the bland beans underneath. I was excited to try the unique beet ravioli but this was another meh dish that was presented much better than it tasted. The cod was fine, nothing special, the sauce was good but still felt very basic. The dessert options were all terrible, our table tried the gingerbread cranberry, chocolate layered mouse and the apple pie and the pie was the best option, but the others weren't worth finishing. I was looking forward to trying the desserts from the regular menu but unfortunately it was not an option for nye. All in all, service and presentation met expectations but the food was forgettable.

originalText.text:
It was a pleasure returning to Café Boulud after several years since my last meal here. We were treated very well and the food was excellent as usual. I especially liked the halibut and my friend had the duck. Everything was artistically plated and the ambiance was beautiful.

I am withholding the fifth star in this review for a small detail in service. I appreciate the attentiveness of the staff as well and noticed some of the junior staff receive some training during our meal. One member of staff nearly gave me the wrong dish and was openly told off and corrected by a more senior staff member. Another came around serving us bread and after declining, came back a minute later to ask again which was a little pushy. I am confident that the junior staff will gain more finesse with experience. That aside, I highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion!

originalText.text: We went there during Restaurant Week and I can say that it was an excellent choice! Everyone was very polite and attentive. The restaurant is elegant and they have a coat check at the entrance which is essential during winter months. All the dishes were beautifully served and were very delicious (especially the chocolate mousse cake!), the portions are not huge but the 3-course lunch was absolutely enough. Only one small thing that could be improved is the bread they served up before the appetizer—it was rather dry. Otherwise highly recommended!

text.text: We went there during Restaurant Week and I can say that it was an excellent choice! Everyone was very polite and attentive. The restaurant is elegant and they have a coat check at the entrance which is essential during winter months. All the dishes were beautifully served and were very delicious (especially the chocolate mousse cake!), the portions are not huge but the 3-course lunch was absolutely enough. Only one small thing that could be improved is the bread they served up before the appetizer—it was rather dry. Otherwise highly recommended!

originalText.text: We had a lunch in the restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. All foods we tried was tasty especially the crescent farm duck which is perfectly cooked with beautiful, crispy duck skin and sauce. The molten chocolate cake was too sweat for us but the tiramisu was deserved a try. Overall we had a wonderful time for the meal.

originalText.text: Cafe Bolouds new space is great! Walked in on a random weeknight for some quick dinner and it was fantastic! Really warm service, great food and a cozy ambiance.
